description: The Git-Tool configuration file allows you to control how Git-Tool behaves on your computer. For more information, look at the documentation: https://git-tool.sierrasoftworks.com/config/

Application.description: The application which should be added to your config.

name.description: The name which will be used to launch this application.

command.description: The binary which will be executed when launching this application.

args.description: The list of command line arguments which will be provided to the program.

items.description: A command line argument which will be provided to the program.

environment.description: The list of environment variables which will be provided to the program.

items.description: An environment variable which will be provided to the program.

Service.description: The service which should be added to your config.

domain.description: The domain which uniquely identifies this service. This will act as the top-level directory for storing repositories.

website.description: The template which will be used to generate the website URL for a given repository hosted on this service.

gitUrl.description: The template which will be used to generate the Git+SSH remote URL for a given repository hosted on this service.

httpUrl.description: The template which will be used to generate the Git+HTTPS remote URL for a given repository hosted on this service.

pattern.description: The pseudo-glob pattern which will be used to determine which level of the directory tree holds repositories (*/* for org/repo style platforms).

directory.description: The directory within which Git-Tool will store your repositories.

scratchpads.description: The directory within which Git-Tool will store your scratchpads. By default this will be a 'scratch' folder inside your normal repo directory.

apps.description: The list of applications which are configured for use on your system.

services.description: The list of services which are configured for use on your system.

aliases.description: The short aliases used to refer to specific repositories.

additionalProperties.description: The fully qualified name of a repository which should be opened when this alias is used.

features.description: The feature flags which are used to control how Git-Tool behaves on your system.

http_transport.description: Whether Git-Tool will use Git's HTTP transport to clone and create repositories.

create_remote.description: Whether Git-Tool will automatically create a repository on your remote hosting provider.

create_remote_private.description: Whether Git-Tool will create Private remote repositories, or Public ones.

open_new_repo_in_default_app.description: Whether Git-Tool will automatically open newly created repositories in your default app.

telemetry.description: Control whether Git-Tool sends crash reports to us or not.

additionalProperties.description: Whether the feature flag is enabled or not.
